original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Dukadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (6)🔽24.18. Saraṇaduka, Nahetusahetukaduka🔽Nasaraṇaṁ nahetuṁ nasahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca araṇo nahetu sahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Nasaraṇaṁ nahetuṁ naahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca araṇo nahetu ahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.🔽Naaraṇaṁ nahetuṁ naahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca araṇo nahetu ahetuko dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  saraṇa duka na hetu sa hetuka duka  na saraṇam na hetum na sa hetukam dhammam paṭicca araṇaḥ na hetu sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka  na saraṇam na hetum na ahetukam dhammam paṭicca araṇaḥ na hetu ahetukaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā eka  na araṇam na hetum na ahetukam dhammam paṭicca araṇaḥ na hetu ahetukaḥ dhammo uppajjati
translated: The reverse order of the law of conditionality, the text of the Paṭṭhāna in pairs🔽The section on the dyads beginning with the unproximate, the dyads on the non-cause and the cause

original: hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā dve, adhipatiyā dve …pe… aññamaññe ekaṁ🔽…pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate dve.
analyzed: hetu paccayā eka saṅkhitta hetuyā dve adhipatiyā dve pe aññamaññe eka 🔽pe vipāke ekam pe avigate dve
translated: With a non-unproximate, non-cause, non-condition state as condition, an unproximate, cause, condition state arises, a condition being present. (In brief.)
